Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) are being extensively researched for clean power generation from coal-derived syngas.
Titulo: Effects of PH3 Contaminant on Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Performance and Related Anode Surface Temperature Measurements

Sentencas: Some of the contaminants in syngas such as phosphine (PH3) may interact with the SOFC anode material, and degrade its electrochemical performance and material properties.
Titulo: Effects of PH3 Contaminant on Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Performance and Related Anode Surface Temperature Measurements

Sentencas: In this paper, a modified Sagnac interferometry method is utilized to monitor the anode surface transient temperature as a function of applied current densities under hydrogen and simulated coal syngas.
Titulo: Effects of PH3 Contaminant on Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Performance and Related Anode Surface Temperature Measurements

Sentencas: Moreover, the poisoning effects of PH3 contaminant on the SOFCs performance are investigated in dry and moist conditions.
Titulo: Effects of PH3 Contaminant on Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Performance and Related Anode Surface Temperature Measurements

Sentencas: The experimental results indicate that the Ni-cermet-based SOFC anode is more susceptible to degradation due to PH3 in the presence of steam than under dry conditions.
Titulo: Effects of PH3 Contaminant on Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Performance and Related Anode Surface Temperature Measurements

Sentencas: These experiments are valuable for the validation and the development of SOFC electrochemical models, and understanding the anode-contaminant interaction.
Titulo: Effects of PH3 Contaminant on Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Performance and Related Anode Surface Temperature Measurements
